text:
- [Narrator] This is
the 1,000 degree knife
versus Bacardi 151.
Look at the fire! Hallelujah!
Okay, I gotta heat up a knife.
What I wanted to do was make a real drink
using flammable liquors, okay?

But before I get into that,
I got to prepare my fruits.

I'm using an 1,000 degree
knife to slice my fruits
to make sure they're nice and roasted.

So this is gonna feature
roasted fruits, okay?

Actually caramelized
fruits, you can see, okay?

'Cause we're going deep on
this, slicing my strawberries.
Slice up my orange.

Every liquor in this that we
use is going to be flammable
to a certain extent, capping it off
with Bacardi 151 at the top, okay?
So now I got my orange cut up, okay,

let me get a little nice
little slice in there.

You can hear it sizzle
and you can smell it.

It's delicious, everything we're
using in this is delicious.
When you put in the knife, you notice that
it shot out juice from the heat.
This awesome, man.
You can watch the little juice splatter.

You saw it spitting out?
The heat's causing that.
Aw man, delicious.
Okay, so now sprinkle on sugar,
because this what I was talking about,
I need these fruits caramelized.
And what this heat's gonna do,

like roasting it with my
thousand-degree knife,
is create a syrup,

so I get this brown
sugar syrup on my fruits.
And if you let it sit there, it hardens,
or caramelizes, and it's good to go. Okay?

Watch me roast the
strawberries and the banana.

That's the best part, like
watch the smoke come off these.
Man, look at this! Whoo! (laughs)
Like fried eggs, homeboy!
Roasting chicken! Good to go, okay?

Never hear about chicken
in a drink, right?
Okay, this the closest thing to it.

So, ice, and then we
put in our fruits, okay?
Bam, bam, good to go!
Now let's get down to business.
Mango rum, white rum, okay?

Those are flammable if you're
add enough heat to them.

Okay, then we come behind it
with coconut rum, banana rum.

Again, both flammable with
the right amount of heat.
Hit that with some spiced rum.
This got a ton of booze in it.

Some passion fruit juice,
just to keep a little
so it don't kill you, okay?

Come behind with a little
grenadine, very tropical,
and then we lay on some Bacardi 151, okay?
That's right homeboy, it's the bomb, okay?
Now, will it light?

Hit it with my knife, took
a little while but boom!
You see the flame go up, it worked, okay?
(upbeat caribbean music)

Okay, that's right,
you hear the loud music
coming in there now?
Uh huh, it's what I dance to, okay?

That's right, I'm twerking
as I'm doing this voiceover
because it's what I do homeboy!

That's right, okay? Now
blow the fire a-boom,
and let's taste this bad boy.
Take a little sip, let me tell you,

this is one of the best
tasting drinks I've ever had

on Tipsy Bartender, and
it is strong as hell.
You got to try this.

Even if you don't do it
with the knife, okay?

'Cause I don't want you
all burning down your house
trying to sue me, alright?
You see that my eyes are rolled back,
when you see my eyes roll back like that,
you know stuff's good.
Stay tipsy my friends, stay tipsy.
